page.description: Get the name of the container object for an object if any.

item.name: Form Controls (for <OBJECT> use the <CONTROL> pointer or the address of the control)

section.description: The <OBJECT>.CONTAINER_GET() method returns the name of the control's container. The method returns NULL ("") unless the control is placed within a container within the form. The method is useful when using tabbed controls and frames. Limitations: Desktop applications only.

section.title: Example
section.example: dim ptr as P dim fld as P ptr = form.load("customerx") fld = ptr.child("Fullname") ? fld.Container_Get() -> "TABBED1.tabs.sheet[2]"
